Selected Answer: B
The License Meter in Splunk runs before data compression

Splunk calculates your license volume based on raw data ingested.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The Forward option in Splunk is used to gather and forward data from remote machines to indexers over a specified receiving por

Selected Answer: B
My previous comment went wrong, so again: I agree with foxx99, as it is written on page 44: "Forward Option: Main source of input in production environments. Remote machines gather and forward data to indexers over a receiving port."

Selected Answer: B
Like foxx99 said, you can find it on page 44: "Selected Answer: A
The "Forward" option in Splunk is used to forward data from a forwarder to an indexer or another forwarder. The forwarder sends data over a network connection to the indexer, which then indexes the data and makes it available for search and analysis."
B - True the forward option is for heavy forwarders. Not a clickable option on universal, I think.

Selected Answer: B
B - True. Page 44 splunk 7x fundamentals
Forward Option - Main source of input in production
environments. Remote machines
gather and forward data to indexers
over a receiving port.

Selected Answer: A
The "Forward" option in Splunk is used to forward data from a forwarder to an indexer or another forwarder. The forwarder sends data over a network connection to the indexer, which then indexes the data and makes it available for search and analysis.
i thought it was from "local"
A is right

questions.question_text: Which of the following represents the Splunk recommended naming convention for dashboards?
You can on-board data to Splunk using following means (Choose four.):

discussion.content:
"On-board" is a slang in businesses to mean that the goal is to have the specific data/technology/devices/things into your corporate environment, which is splunk in this case. 

B,C,E,G are correct. 
B - you can run a command to ingest data
C - you can use splunk web to ingest data 
E - you can install Splunk add ons that have scripts (inputs.conf) to ingest data
G - you can make your own inputs.conf to ingest data

Selected Answer: BCEG
CLI, Splunkweb, Splunk apps and add-ons, inputs.conf
Page 41 of Splunk Fundamentals PDF. I wasn't sure what the writers of this question meant by "on-board" but I suppose they meant "add data inputs"
